reviewText: My sons (4 and 2) love this movie, and at 39 so do I.  Classic pulp adventure, fantasy violence, and the LEGO characters actually build things (unlike some of the other LEGO cartoons on the market).  It's not high class cinema by any stretch of the imagination, but its fun.
Title: N/A

reviewText: That's how our 5 year old rated this movie. Long story short: We came to realize that he gets nervous when he finds a character is in danger. Like when Clutch is dealing with the rock monster, or later when Clutch encounters the goblin (who gobbles him up), or when the Lego-team is battling the wizard. He's not particular fond of fire-spewing dragons either. Perhaps he's still a bit too young to watch this movie alone.In spite all this he still likes this movie a lot. While nervous, he still laughs through the "scary" parts. He loves the skeletons, especially two silly ones, and the black one on the horse at the end. But he only watches the movie if I, or his mom, or elder sisters watches it with him.I do find it indeed a nice and fun movie for kids. As reviewer Leah (mom of 2), pointed out in her review, there are some lines and words used in it, that I also could have lived without (especially for 4 or 5 year olds). But not real big deal. It's also full of action. It's fun. I'm thinking older then 5 year kids may like this movie more, but if watch with parents the very young ones (4 and 5 year) will also still like it a lot.Since our 5 year old is a bit scared by it, I feel I can't rate 5 stars, but since he still likes it a lot, I rate it 4 stars.Tip: It might be handy to have some Lego around, when kids watch this movie. Our son is not a particular Lego kid. Does play with Lego from time to time, but I would not say it's his favorite toy. But this movie is always an inspiration to play with Lego after watching it.Thnks for reading.Ps. I'm actually very surprised this is the first Lego movie. I mean, I know they have several Lego computer games, so I thought for sure they had already produce movies. Apparently not. I guess Playmobil beat Lego on bringing out a movie then. Sometime ago we got thePlaymobil: The Secret of Pirate IslandPlaymobil pirates DVD for our son. He actually likes the Playmobil one very much. I guess that has to do with the Pirates theme. He's all in to pirates lately. But it's a fun movie too, with lots of fun and entertaining songs. He liked it a lot and wasn't scared at any moment. He watches it alone all the time. You can read my review on it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This film is a spectacular thrill-ride of horror,sci-fi, adventure, action, romantic, comedy delight!It stars Clutch Powers, thats right, THE Clutch Powers.ADVENTURER EXTRAORDINAIRE!Along his side in this journey he will be joined by the beautiful, alluring Peg Mooring. The goofy, hip young Bernie von Beam. And the tough bad-a** firefighter, Brick Masterson.As they track down the evil Wizard, Mallock the Malign!Just outta prison, and looking for a sword, this baddie has plans that could devastate the entire universe!Throughout this mighty adventure, Clutch deals with past father issues, Bernie and Peg form a romantic relationship, and Mallock is up to no good!This film has it all, like I say above. Theres action, adventure, fantasy, sci-fi, comedy, romance, all into one!I strongly recommend this film for any movie lover.And, if you got a family, not bad for the kids to view. All around a rockin' time!Buy it, there must be sequels to this masterpiece!
summary: SWEET JESUS! MY MIND JUST BLEW!

reviewText: A remarkably good film aimmed at the 8 and younger crowd.  Clever.  Funny.  The story kinda rambles around, but I didn't mind.  There are a few scary seens (scary for my 4 year old), and some cartoonish violence, but nothing objectionable in my opinion.  Not quite "Cars" but better than most films for young kids.  One might complain that it's a 90 minute commercial for legos, but we love legos, so we didn't care.
summary: Best movie for my 4 year old Lego fan

reviewText: I bought this for my 3 1/2 year old nephew. Popped the DVD in the player and I enjoyed it just as much as he did. I have now become a LEGO and LEGO Movie/Cartoon Series fan because of Clutch Powers. It's got color, adventure, and a flowing story line for the kids and the jokes are more tongue in cheek for the adults who (are old enough to) know what the characters are making a reference to. Hilarious! I'm definitely going to buy other DVD's by LEGO.
summary: Bought For Nephew, Ended Up Liking It Myself

reviewText: Older brickheads and young Lego enthusiasts alike will have a blast with this highly enjoyable LEGO adventure on DVD.  My son had a grand time spotting his toys amongst the action of the overall superb animation (especially the backgrounds).  The story is fun and jumps around the LEGO universe in a ridiculous fashion, the humour is overall perfect for the age group this is aimed at and fun for those still young at heart.  The feature presentation is well worth the admission price but for another awesome experience check out the 6 min stop motion Space Police  mini movies in the extras it is really cool and fun to watch the actual toys come to life in a way that my son and I have attempted on our own with the PS3s eye movie software.  The kiddies are gonna hit the repeat button on this one, a must buy for the brick clicker in your house.
